title: Just be a good person. It's not that hard.
body: I have lost so many games because people just can't seem to not flame each other. Like it's not that hard to be a good person! If somebody starts to be toxic to you, just mute them and move on! Literally just be decent human beings instead of Chernobyl.

I'm brand new, and I know full well that I suck because I know literally almost nothing.  I don't know the champions, I know a little about the roles, I don't know a lot of things.  I will always try my best not to make mistakes, and it doesn't help to get crapped on when I make one.  I learn nothing other than "try not to do that if you can avoid it" which, in the end, only makes me hesitant and MORE likely to make another mistake.

You were all at this point once.  It is true that some people can't take advice or think they are the only good player alive, but not all of us are that way.  I want to learn and get better.  I want to be a better teammate.  I want to be a better player.  But the player base is so utterly toxic that even my nearly endless patience is hurting.  I need advice and encouragement, not to be reported for feeding for being out of position one time.

Being a good person can be difficult to some, but in league its super freaking easy! 

Step 1. Don't be a douche.

Step 2. Be nice.

Step 3. If someone makes a comment that gets you tilted mute them right away then move on. 
 
Step 4. You have so much higher morale this way, you, and possibly even your team, will play better! 


Its so simple it baffles me that so many people can't do it. 

If a teammate is sucking, you think flaming them is going to make them play better? OF COURSE NOT! Flaming em will only make their morale lower, and as such play worse. Friendly encouragement will actually bring their morale up, and they might even play better cuz of it.

Yeah, be a good person: Don't be vain, and don't identify by silly words or ideas. If someone can talk in a video game and get under your skin, there's an issue there. If you feel the need to deny them doing anything (a ban, etc.), then that's just an eye for an eye, which is not a good thing either.

A good person wouldn't freak the fuck out whenever someone talked bad about them, they'd just kind of ignore it and continue on being nice, instead of being some vain, vengeful little asshat that has a tantrum if someone uses one of the no-no words or says ANYTHING that isn't sickeningly positive about any life choices they make (sexuality being one of those), or what race happened to give birth to them, what place they're from, or anything along those terms.

Now, if we're talking the PC version of a good person full of double standards, sure, go on and preach. But if you're talking an actual good person... I really don't think you know what that is.
Then why did Riot spend so much money on creating a behavioral analysis system/team?

First off, it's not a big system, it's a computer that just automatically punishes people who get enough reports to get flagged, and have trigger words in their games.

Second, it's so that the whales can feel good about themselves since they don't get banned, and are happy to spend more money.

Didn't used to be. Was the tribunal, which I'm sure was a pain in the ass to keep running. Fact: Riot has spent too much money on the behavioral side of this game to justly ignore shit like this. They were hiring Ph.D. psychologists to analyze player behavior and create the system you see today. Hiring Ph.Ds is not cheap.
